user.biography:
Maps for the people and planet.
Join our work:

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Decolonial Atlas on July 29, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text:
You're not king. You're the only one who pays to live in the kingdom.⠀
⠀
Interesting note: This 1857 "Paleontological Chart" preceded Darwin's "On the Origin of Species" by 2 years. As the “tree of life” became synonymous with evolution, the author of the chart, a fervent creationist, stopped using the tree concept he'd popularized.

node.text: Birth places of the 100 fastest 1500m runners of all time.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by The Decolonial Atlas on July 27, 2021. May be an image of map and text that says 'U.S. Bombing of Korea, 1950-1953 /u/J-Hust'.

node.text:
North Korea ranks among the most heavily-bombed countries in history, surpassed only by the US attacks on Laos and Vietnam. Over 3 years, the US destroyed nearly all of the country's cities and towns, including 85% of its buildings. By the end of the campaign, US bombers had difficulty finding anything left to bomb. With their housing turned to rubble, millions of Koreans had to dig shelter underground to survive.⠀
⠀
The Korean War Armistice was signed July 27, 1953.⠀
⠀
Map: /u/J-Hust

Interpreting and predicting the spread of invasive wild pigs. Journal of Applied Ecology.'.

node.text: Invasive feral pigs are one of the most damaging invasive species on Earth, uprooting soil at vast scales.

May be an image of big cat and text that says 'Africa from Wild World, a map by Anton Thomas A world map about nature, Wild World is hand-drawn drawn with colour pencil and fine-liner pen. As June 2021, the Americas, Europe, Africa, and half of Asia have been drawn. Along with the remaining land, the ocean is yet to be drawn. It will show bathymetry and have many sea creatures. At present there are over 350 animals featured across the map. www.antonthomasart.com/wild-world ©AntonThomasArt,2021 (T, www.antonthomasart.com'.

Photo by The Decolonial Atlas on July 24, 2021. May be an image of map and text that says 'Average heat- heat-related annual excess deaths in 2000-2019 Zhao, 2 et l. (2021). The Lancet Planetary Health. 50 180 400'.

node.text: From 2000 to 2019, 9.4% of deaths globally were associated with extreme temperatures. That's more than 5 million deaths/year. Currently, more people die from cold exposure than heat, but heat-related deaths are on the rise around the world.

node.text:
sinixt təmxwúlaʔxw (Sinixt territory), in the headwaters of the ntx̌ witkw (Columbia River), has been mapped in sn-səlxcín (the Interior Salish dialect of the Sinixt).

“The specific language of our land holds important knowledge about this land, about how to live here and honour it. In spite of how much has been lost, my ancestors keep urging me to continue this work. This land is hungry for the language it birthed millenia ago.” - Marilyn James, Autonomous Sinixt

Map: Dayna Fidler, www.maapress.ca

node.text:
Even so-called 'naturalists' like John James Audubon and Teddy Roosevelt advocated for wolf eradication because of the threat they posed to valuable livestock, ignoring the fact that the wolf's natural prey, such as bison, had all but been exterminated. This attitude enabled a centuries-long extermination campaign that nearly wiped out the gray wolf in the US by 1950.

Map: Wikipedia

May be an image of map and text that says 'Canada Following the sharks Migration area and paths of 179 white sharks tagged along central California coast during 2000-2008. The sharks mainly congregated off three locations: California, Hawaii and an area in between dubbed the "White Shark Cafe." Migration area of all 179 sharks Paths of six tagged sharks from the Bay Area Sạn Francisco Midway Island Hawaii 500 miles "White Shark Cafe" Source: Stanford University MERCURY NEWS'.

node.text:
White Shark Café is the ocean's hottest club.⠀
⠀
Map: Mercury News
